config is old and awful, i'll port it to awesome 4.0 someday

![awesome](http://i.imgur.com/Cf4QrSJ.jpg)
I haven't really changed much in a long time.  I'm pretty satisfied with my current setup.  I'll probably test out all the new stuff in 4.0 and update things pretty soon.

![holo 3.0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1777696/22108040/770b28ce-de51-11e6-8255-c4692bde1243.png)

EDIT: I suggest posting links to configs as well. Mine is in the image.

Modified and converted to Awesome4 @copycat-killer 's powerarrow theme
![2017-01-15-034557_1440x900_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/207721/21957626/349fa9bc-dad5-11e6-999f-8c2b12c9e876.png)

Not much has changed, haven't had time. That, and pretty happy with it as is.
![watchin videos](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10911620/21959225/f27ee450-da7d-11e6-82bd-837d2a1cdc3f.png)

Laptop setup:
![laptop](https://i.imgur.com/ddiWkq4.png)

[Full album](https://imgur.com/a/XuVQS#8QIvNJo) I made for /r/unixporn a while ago.
And [here](https://github.com/woefe/dotfiles/tree/old/awesomewm/.config/awesome) is my config.

![starman-fakebusy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/534033/22008021/9107319c-dc34-11e6-94a0-22abd02daf3a.png)
[My desktop](https://github.com/thekrampus/awesome-starman). 2nd monitor omitted -- it's the same thing but bigger.
(I'm particularly proud of the [music widget](https://github.com/thekrampus/awesome-jammin))
Here's my tablet config. It's in dire need of an update, though... When the keyboard isn't attached, the volume buttons are rebound to modkeys, so you can still use your keybindings.

One last one (workflow)

Made to show @osleg how the session serialization, tabbing and dynamic layout work in my config

(note that the gif is longer than the gyfcat link)

![_001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15304135/22242861/9ed6bcb2-e22d-11e6-89ac-c00910e41b49.png)
It's still a work in progress, but the overall look and feel is done.

Still work in progress, don't have much time to improve.. sadly
![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9730330/22253577/6ce9e434-e252-11e6-8999-a36d34ee282b.png)

![1485288108](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/110966/22288558/a00f70f4-e2f7-11e6-97f5-3da484e97c68.png)
Autocolors via [wal](https://github.com/dylanaraps/wal)
Still some room for improvement, but overall i am happy with the setup for now.

Rc.lua and theme.lua here: https://github.com/Ocularis/awesome-chameleon

Is there a size limit?
![](http://sleepanarchy.com/static/media/uploads/screenshots/desktop_2017_01_29.png)
Started with powerarrow-darker from copycat-killer/awesome-copycats, made it match the molokai vim theme(which is also used in urxvt & firefox). 

Use tyrannical for tag management & lain for widgets:
https://github.com/prikhi/awesome-config
https://github.com/prikhi/dotfiles

Thanks to the new API, I finally satisfied [this request](https://github.com/copycat-killer/awesome-copycats/issues/53).

![scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1777696/22441596/59d35fc0-e738-11e6-8258-19df6f7216c2.jpg)

![20170130212903](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1777696/22441603/6236b5a4-e738-11e6-8553-0900bbaa1490.png)

The left panel is auto-hiding, and the colorscheme is made with [val](https://github.com/dylanaraps/wal) from the wallpaper.

![2017-02-02-194723_1920x1080_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22544090/22548388/22116eba-e981-11e6-84b3-9e0b21d41229.png)

Colorscheme for AwesomeWM and termite is slightly modified [base16-harmonic-dark](https://github.com/chriskempson/base16); [DuckDuckGo also uses a similar custom colorscheme](https://duckduckgo.com/?key=2765f4ce61c816d1ff20fc356e3e9e2ce73626c054fa5a88c33ed8881768e8953b99dcc733839c6444544d05ffc1b7f31752f1881d6a5162745c01689eab2f05). Firefox uses the [Strange Blue theme](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/strange-blue/?src=ss), along with the [Stylish](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/stylish/) add-on with ['Linux GTK+ Theme'](https://userstyles.org/styles/132191/firefox-theme-linux-gtk-native-fx-29) style.

Dotfiles (WIP) here: https://github.com/Relsre/dotfiles

Look how much you can do with so little.

This is my Arch setup for a HP Pavilion DV7-1097la notebook. The computers has 7 years with full heavy use and it still runs fast enough for getting this bad boy running.

So... in resume. If you want to get full command on your system for maximum perfomance AwesomeWM is the way to go. 

![captura de pantalla_2017-02-04_04-21-39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17091659/22616863/5a3f031e-ea95-11e6-98b6-eab520297204.png)

More:
https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17091659/22616860/5a3de4ca-ea95-11e6-86c1-943ccf8a269e.png

https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17091659/22616862/5a3edb96-ea95-11e6-81d3-7edbc2b1297c.png

![captura de pantalla_2017-02-04_04-39-48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17091659/22616861/5a3e37d6-ea95-11e6-9377-f8af7a5e4f6d.png)

Software used: Firefox w/ Arc theme, Sublime Text 3 Dev, Ncmpcpp, cava, feh, neofetch.
System and other info in the screenshoot. 

Hope you liked it.

![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15304135/23146805/c6b43212-f7e2-11e6-87dd-798ccba62029.png)

Still very much a work in progress. The foundation is just about there, all that is left is to expand and clean it up. The wibox in the top centre position hides when no music is playing, and it's always on top when there is.

config files can be found at:
https://github.com/ProfessorOptics/FeatherWings/tree/master/dotfiles/awesome

A port to 4.x of the original powerarrow by @romockee.

My current setup. I call it "Sea". Here are the [config](https://github.com/ProfessorOptics/FeatherWings.fixed/tree/master/dotfiles/awesome) files.

![welp, your interwebs died. There should be a screenie here.](http://i.imgur.com/ITLmbbh.png)

Installed, just proving it like a huge noob. Great WM! Please delete this screen-shot, when you see fit. It does not do your work justice. 

![2017-06-06-042602_1366x768_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9447152/26802029/8f2e3806-4a71-11e7-9dee-76c51c7eb59a.png)

If i was a laptop, seeing another laptop with this, i'd have an organism on the spot.

yet another powerline theme:

![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12297655/27010094-1f934eac-4e9d-11e7-81da-c8524090ee11.png)

The powerline in the upper wibar uses the "real" powerline while the lower one (only pops up for 5 sec when hitting keybind or switching the layout) is made of awesomewidgets/shapes.

EDIT:
[here are my configs](https://github.com/martingabelmann/awesome-powerline)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/340384/46047305-9f2dd600-c0f2-11e8-8e2c-0741c023fbd6.png)

[Elv13 edit: Re-upload, the link was dead]

Here are some screenshots of [my config](https://github.com/timroes/awesome-config), featuring:

* Mostly used in fullscreen mode, with some floating windows (*first screen*)
* Custom tag widget to switch to tags/clients (*first screen*)
* Custom brightness/volume controls (*first screen*)
* A client switcher using hotkeys (or mouse) (*second screen*)
* A custom launcher built in Lua (*third screen*)
* Custom notification layout with actions (*fourth gif*)

![Overview of my awesome config](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/877229/27581504-2cda62f6-5b2e-11e7-8d8a-01a7537eb87b.png)

![Mac like clientswitcher](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/877229/27581640-847cad20-5b2e-11e7-93f8-5a8f6e49a084.png)

![Custom launcher](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/877229/27581701-b210e0ee-5b2e-11e7-8567-9a1580418830.png)

![Notifications with custom action design](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/877229/27581731-ca3fe76e-5b2e-11e7-8960-4b41903840ac.gif)

![awesome-ut](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/315259/30217411-57923228-94b6-11e7-9532-0e19f71366ff.png)

managed to have custom focus style, using 4 titlebars + dynamic image creation with Cairo. Thx to @Elv13  :)

My heavily-customized work-flow. Most of the time I am in maximized or vertical split (tiling) layouts. I bind on-top and floating together, effectively defining two layers -- tiling and floating. Also use xfce4-panel mainly for its systray, because of #891

![4-floating-on-top](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9053690/30942398-b67a6d12-a39f-11e7-954e-89a6151dd634.png)

Config is here:
https://github.com/zhangkun83/awesome-config
The default branch 3.5 works on awesome 3.5.9. I am in the process of migrating to awesome 4.2 on the master branch.

The floating layout is prettier, but less frequently used:
![4-floating](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9053690/30942649-e8f20da8-a3a0-11e7-870b-1431ab5714cb.png)

![Awesome wm screenshot](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mimr9/awesome/master/images/1_001.png)
using:
* awesome v4.2
* Lua 5.1.5

and for jalali calendar, using jcal - jdate program for converting date to jalali ( persian/farsi ) calendar

![Screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/aBNG2DX.png)
https://github.com/vgavro/dotfiles/tree/master/.config/awesome
awesome v4.2, widgets based on vicious, keyboard layout with flag indicator

So glad to be back.
![2017-11-06-171350_1366x768_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13081443/32454096-1302a06e-c316-11e7-83ef-9b8c8a368f0d.png)

https://github.com/twentytwoo/awesome

![awesome](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15572276/33797828-eb23524c-dd0e-11e7-8ed1-7c31d8fbb9c2.png)
awesome v4.2, some widgets with vicious, others by hand, desktop content on the wallpaper using cairo and lua-filesystem (lfs).
EDIT: Finally my [config](https://github.com/alcubierre-drive/awesome-config).

![screenshot from 2018-02-06 08-29-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1226803/35852979-014507ba-0b35-11e8-8388-6024bac63a13.png)
color scheme dracula, vertical progress bars for cpu mem temp and net, hovering shows tooltip with stats
Also, it would be nice to see some of those fancy screenshots in [r/unixporn](https://www.reddit.com/r/unixporn/). It would catch some new eyes to awesome.

/r/unixporn mod here. UP is a very "trend" driven sub. a certain wm will get popular and we get flooded with them. we're living in the d̶a̶r̶k̶ age of i3 right now. that being said, there are multiple awesome posts in the top 500 posts of all time. the vast majority of awesomewm subs we get a very generic or highly uncustomized, so they get downvoted. post something fresh, new and unique and give your wm of choice some love and proper representation.

![pro-light](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2269864/35999470-f07448fa-0ced-11e8-9667-dd16b2eb8f0c.png)
![pro-dark](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2269864/35999471-f31847e6-0ced-11e8-92a4-25c523fefb4f.png)
![pro-medium-light](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2269864/35999481-f783795e-0ced-11e8-816d-99f0e56ccd20.png)
![pro-medium-dark](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2269864/35999484-f9a9f2da-0ced-11e8-84b6-3b4edefd3562.png)
![pro-gotham](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2269864/35999485-fb55062e-0ced-11e8-9c0e-077d97edeb82.png)

I have started to port the [stobenski pro themes](https://github.com/stobenski/pro) to Awesome WM 4.x version. For now, it works but you can find some glitches with widgets or fonts or colours =) I would be appreciated if you try it and help me by creating issues.

[Dotfiles + repository](https://github.com/4ban/awesome-pro)

![current](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13081443/36066200-dc4d58b0-0e9d-11e8-914f-2c563151a8bb.jpg)
current setup with rofi and my notification script
https://github.com/twentytwoo/awesome

![2018-02-26-00 03 39-screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28696815/36651675-da110c76-1a88-11e8-812b-a300342315ac.png)

Tried to bring an old-timey feel to my setup. Amber (#FFBF00) on black (#111111), plain and simple.

![2018-03-07_235941_full](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22544090/37384152-56fd7326-27a1-11e8-8997-42c44919f530.png)

Awesome themed around a wallpaper of the game [Hyper Light Drifter](https://www.heart-machine.com), and the colorscheme [Base16 Atelier Cave (Dark)](https://github.com/khamer/base16-termite/blob/master/themes/base16-atelier-cave.config). I'm also using an [Oomox](https://github.com/actionless/oomox) (Numix-based) GTK+ theme of the same colorscheme (slightly modified from the preset). Tag status icons are from the [Awesome copycats multicolor theme](https://github.com/lcpz/awesome-copycats/tree/master/themes/multicolor), with colors modified.

More details in dotfiles: https://github.com/Relsre/dotfiles/tree/MiAir-base16-atelier-cave
